==Chinese==

===Etymology===
* The character '''字''', in this sense means [[-shaped]], while the character '''丁''' just signifies a capital ''T'' shape. Literally, it could mean '''丁-shaped'''.

After fighting for thirty bouts, they were unable to bring down {{w|Lü Bu}}.|ref={{circa|1330–1400}} {{w|Luo Guanzhong}}, ''[[s:Romance of the Three Kingdoms/Chapter 5#32|Romance of the Three Kingdoms/Chapter 5]]''}}
